messageBody:
I do not think I understand how to use fixtures. I have looked at the
FAQ and junit documentation on line and it is not helping me with my
problem.

As far as I can tell I am implementing fixtures the correct way. I
declare the objects I want to test as private member variables in
ProgramTest which extends TestCase. I then initialize the objects in
setUp().

When I run ProgramTest setUp() is called but the tests themselves give
null pointer exceptions. When I create each object under each
individual test method the tests work as expected. Obviously I am not
writing the fixture correctly, but I cannot figure what I am doing
wrong. If this matters, I am developing on Mac OS X Jaguar. The
sample code provided with junit download runs correctly.

To run this program, I am putting ProgramTest.class, MyProgram.class
and junit.jar in same directory and using
java -cp junit.jar:. ProgramTest in command line. I have experimented
with this code and find that JUnit calls setUp() and tearDown()
correctly, but somehow the objects do not carry over to the individual
test methods.
This is the code for my test:


import junit.framework.*;
public class ProgramTest extends junit.framework.TestCase {
private MyProgram word;
private MyProgram game;
private MyProgram anotherWord;

protected void setUp() {
// if this code is put under each individual test method, it runs
correctly

MyProgram word = new MyProgram("Word", MyProgram.WORDPROCESSOR);
word.setPrice(50);
MyProgram game = new MyProgram("Game", MyProgram.GAME);
game.setPrice(30);
MyProgram anotherWord = new MyProgram("Word",
MyProgram.WORDPROCESSOR);
anotherWord.setPrice(50);
}

protected void tearDown() {
word = null;
game = null;
anotherWord = null;
}
public void testPriceIncrease() {
int expected = 80;
game.increasePrice(word.getPrice());
int result = game.getPrice();
Assert.assertEquals(expected, result);
}

public void testEquals() {
Assert.assertTrue(!word.equals(null));
Assert.assertTrue(word.equals(word));
Assert.assertTrue(word.equals(anotherWord));
Assert.assertTrue(!word.equals(game));
Assert.assertEquals(word, word);
Assert.assertEquals(word, anotherWord);
}

public void testGetPrice() {
int expected = 50;
int result = word.getPrice();
Assert.assertEquals(expected, result);
}

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(ProgramTest.class);
}

public static void main(String args[]) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(ProgramTest.class);
}
}

public class MyProgram {
private String name;
private int task;
public static final int WORDPROCESSOR = 1,
SPREADSHEET = 2, GAME = 3;
private int price;

public MyProgram(String s, int t) {
name = s;
task = t;
}
public void setPrice(int p) {
price = p;
}
public int getPrice() {
return price;
}
public String getName() {
return name;
}
public int getTask() {
return task;
}
public void increasePrice(int increase) {
price += increase;
}

task == (MyProgram)testProgram.getTask() &&
price == (MyProgram)testProgram.getPrice()) {
return true;
}
else {
return false;
}
}

}
